instructions: Sign in to your Play Console . Select an app. On the left menu, click Release management > App releases . If you don t see App releases in the menu, make sure you have permission to manage production releases . For the release you want to update, select Edit release . At the bottom of your screen, find the "Rollout countries" section. Select the down arrow . Select the countries where you'd like to start the rollout.

Sign in to your Play Console . Select an app. On the left menu, click Release management > App releases . If you don t see App releases in the menu, make sure you have permission to manage releases . For the release you want to update, select Update rollout . Select a percentage. Click Update rollout .

Sign in to your Play Console . Select an app. On the left menu, click Release management > App releases . If you don t see App releases in the menu, make sure you have permission to manage releases . Under the release track you want to halt, select Manage . Next to the release version number, select Halt rollout > Halt .
Open the Play Console app . Select an app. On the "Active releases" card, tap the track for the release you want to halt. Tap Staged rollout > Halt rollout > Halt .

Sign in to your Play Console . Select an app. On the left menu, click Release management > App releases . For the release you want to resume, click Resume rollout . Select a percentage. Click Update .
Open the Play Console app . Select an app. On the "Active releases" card, tap the track for the release you want to resume. Tap Staged rollout > Resume rollout > Resume .
